column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There was a smaller yarding of 148 trade and grown cattle at Powranna on Tuesday with about 100 being cows and bulls. The trade cattle averaged a few cents higher with yearling steers making 280c to 318c and heifers 274c to 316c.
There were 85 cows and all sold to strong competition with heavy pens making 265c to 288c, leaner D2 cows 240c to 265c and lean D1 cows 150c to 230c with most of these going back to the paddock,
Heavy bulls made 200c to 220c/kg live.

Market Reporter Richard Bailey
